Course Name: ACG 4342 - COST ACCOUNTING PRINCIPLES AND APPLICATIONS
Course Description: THIS COURSE PROVIDES A SURVEY OF THE THEORY AND APPLICATION OF COST ACCOUNTING PRINCIPLES. TOPICS INCLUDE COST BEHAVIORS, PRODUCTION COSTING METHODS, DATA PROCESSING, ECONOMIC ANALYSIS, BUDGETING, AND MANAGEMENT AND FINANCIAL CONTROL. TOPICS INCLUDE HOW TO IDENTIFY, MEASURE, AND ACCUMULATE DIRECT AND INDIRECT COSTS, HOW TO APPLY BURDEN, INTRODUCTION TO JOB COSTING SYSTEMS, BUDGETING, COST-VOLUME-PROFIT RELATIONSHIPS, AND RELEVANT COSTING.
Objectives / Learning Outcome(s) / Major:
1.ANALYZE AND APPLY COST ACCOUNTING THEORIES TO REAL WORLD BUSINESS SCENARIOS.
2.CREATE A PROCESS AND PLAN TO MEASURE THE PERFORMANCE OF MANAGERS WITHIN AN ORGANIZATION.
3.DESIGN AN ACCOUNTING SYSTEM TO FIT THE PRODUCTION AND DISTRIBUTION SYSTEM OF AN ORGANIZATION
